content.description: A mostly fun route right of Dick Van Dyke.  Fun start on great reachy plates. Higher, the route gets thinner with hard to reach bolts. Maybe fa party was tall or they made the bolts reachy on purpose?? At a higher crux you could get a piece of gear, maybe .4 C4 or orange Metolius?
content.protection: 7 or 8 bolts and optional finger size gear, 2 bolt rap anchor

climbs.name: Granitology
climbs.fa: Mike Melkonian and Neil Satterfield, August 2003

content.description: Very sustained thin face climbing past 18 bolts leads you to the anchors of this magnificent climb.
content.protection: 18 bolts, anchors. Two ropes to rap off.
content.location: 10' left of the fingercrack Community Service, on the right side of the Northeast Face

climbs.name: Dick Van Dyke
climbs.fa: Mike Strassman, Wendy Bogerd, Scott Ayers, 1980s.

content.description:
Climb the obvious vertical dike on the left side of the Northeast Face. After clipping the last bolt, either continue straight up the dyke that slowly diminishes (10a) or step 5' right and continue up a much easier dyke that goes directly to the anchor (8). This is a fun route.

Anchor: chain links that need to be threaded to lower down (or walk off right).

Climb up some mossy ledges to reach a steepening finger crack. The crack eventually peters out for some cruxy moves past two bolts. After the second bolt climb up and left then a bit of a runout to reach a bottoming hand size groove.
content.location: Far right side of the Northeast Face.
